mainly consists of Na sp states, C sp states O sp states, and N
sp states. The top of the VB is composed of O p states and N
sp states and the bottom of CB mainly consists of C sp states

O has a large birefringence of 0.368 at 1064 nm (
a). The largest reﬂective index is in the (0 0 1) direction and

high electron densities owing to strong covalent C

atom, which is composed of umbrella-shaped N 2s lone pairs
and O nonbonding 2p electrons. Six parallel p

respectively. It indicates that the H
groups display strong covalent property. As is known to all, the
covalent property is beneﬁcial for optical anisotropy and
generating large birefringence for the compounds. In

groups. In addition, the phase-matching wavelength of

O were computed to further understand
the NLO properties. The space group
2 point group and possesses 2 nonzero independent
under the restriction of Kleinman symmetry. The theoretically

To further investigate the origin of the SHG eﬀects in
O, the donation of individual atoms
in virtual-electron (VE) transition process was computed using
the SHG-density method, and the SHG-density of VE
a,b, respectively. For the occupied state, O
p and N p orbitals make a signiﬁcant contribution to the SHG
eﬀect. In unoccupied states, the O p, N p, and C p orbitals
make the main contribution. These results indicate that the
In summary, the single crystal of Rb
was obtained with the hydrothermal method in a short
synthesis period. The calculated birefringence of Rb
O is about 0.368, its ultraviolet (UV) cutoﬀ
edge is down to 230 nm, the SHG intensity is about 0.2
KDP, and phase matchable. We believe that this work could
contribute to the development of the cyanurates and hydro-
